revised_title: The Chemical Composition of Pearls and Cocoa-Nut Pearls
tldr: The authors analyze the chemical composition of pearls and cocoa-nut pearls, discovering that they consist of water, organic matter, and calcium carbonate. They also find that pearls have a different composition than mother-of-pearl, with pearls containing more organic matter and less water. The authors question the origin of a cocoa-nut pearl they examined, as its chemical composition and structure closely resemble those of shellfish pearls.
